location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 23 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing a communication the Resident has received from Captain Frederick Faithfull (not present), along with his reply (also not present). It notes that the lack of new instructions from the Bombay Government has restricted how explicit the Resident has been able to be in indicating the extent that the British can interpose in disputes between Arab tribes.
